Judul: Evidence of charge density wave with anisotropic gap in a monolayer VTe2 film
Abstrak:
We report experimental evidence of a charge density wave (CDW) transition in a monolayer 1T -VTe2
film. Low-energy electron diffraction measurements reveal 4 × 4 reconstruction peaks below TCDW = 186 K.
Angle-resolved photoemission spectroscopy measurements reveal arclike pockets with anisotropic CDW gaps up to 50 meV. The anisotropic CDW gap is attributed to the imperfect nesting of the CDW wave vector, and first-principles calculations reveal phonon softening at the same vector. These results suggest the important roles of both Fermi-surface nesting and the electron-phonon interaction in the CDW mechanism of a monolayer VTe2 film.
